wasteQuestionnaireQuestionsPage.title: Tell Us About Your Business
wasteQuestionnaireQuestionsPage.question: Which of the following are true?
wasteQuestionnaireQuestionsPage.footer: To learn more about waste permits, visit [NJDEP’s page on Sustainable Waste Management](https://www.nj.gov/dep/dshw/).

wasteQuestionnaireOptions.hazardousMedicalWaste: My business will generate `hazardous waste|hazardous-waste` or medical waste.
wasteQuestionnaireOptions.compostWaste: My business will `compost waste|compost-waste` on site.
wasteQuestionnaireOptions.treatProcessWaste: My business will treat or process waste.
wasteQuestionnaireOptions.constructionDebris: My business will process `construction/demolition|construction-and-debris` debris and recyclable materials.
wasteQuestionnaireOptions.noWaste: None of the above apply to my business.

wasteQuestionnaireResultsPage.title: Actions to Take
wasteQuestionnaireResultsPage.summary: Based on your answers, your business may be legally required to have a Department of Environmental Protection’s (DEP) waste license or permit. Find out your business' requirements below.

personalizedSupport.title: Contact DEP’s Small Business Assistance Program (SBAP)
personalizedSupport.body: An expert at SBAP can help you figure out which permits your business needs.SBAP does not regulate or enforce environmental rules.

contactDep.title: Contact DEP
contactDep.heading: Waste Requirements
contactDep.body: To find out which licenses or permits you need, contact the [Division of Sustainable Waste Management](https://www.nj.gov/dep/dshw/):

lowApplicability.summaryLine1: You most likely will not need to apply for permits with the Department of Environmental Protection (DEP).
lowApplicability.summaryLine2: Visit [DEP’s Permits, Applications & Registrations page](https://dep.nj.gov/permits-applications-registrations/) for more information about your license and permit needs.
lowApplicability.callout: If your business activities or equipment change at any point,
